sections.title: Introduction
content: Ceylon Tea, grown in Sri Lanka’s central highlands, is celebrated for its regional diversity and crisp flavor.
The 'Lion logo' certifies 100% Sri Lankan-origin tea, packed locally.
Districts like Nuwara Eliya and Uva produce unique profiles, akin to wine terroirs.

sections.title: Farming Techniques
content: Planting: Camellia sinensis cuttings in well-drained mountain soils.
Pruning: Biennial trimming to maintain 'plucking table' height.
Plucking: Hand-picked 'two leaves and a bud' for premium grades.
Shade Management: Legume trees reduce sun stress in low-elevation estates.

sections.title: Environmental Requirements
content: Climate: Tropical, with 1500–2500 mm annual rainfall.

sections.title: Disease & Pest Management
content: Diseases: Blister Blight (copper fungicides), Root Rot (drainage).
Pests: Tea Mosquito Bug (neem oil), Red Spider Mite (miticides).
Organic Options: Bio-controls like Beauveria bassiana fungus.

sections.title: Processing & Grades
content: CTC: Crush-Tear-Curl for strong black teas.
Grades: OP (Orange Pekoe), BOP (Broken), Dust (for bags).

sections.title: Tips for Success
content: Time plucking to monsoon 'quality seasons' (dry periods).
Strictly adhere to Lion logo packaging rules for export.
Experiment with elevation-specific blends for niche markets.
